alert.note: Alert for Kauai North; Kauai Southwest; Koolau Windward; Maui Windward West; Molokai North; Molokai West; Molokai Windward; Niihau; Oahu North Shore; Waianae Coast; Windward Haleakala (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Warning issued January 02 at 3:31PM HST until January 03 at 6:00AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...HIGH SURF WARNING FOR NORTH AND WEST FACING SHORES OF KAUAI NIIHAU OAHU AND MOLOKAI AND FOR NORTH FACING SHORES OF MAUI... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY FOR WEST FACING SHORES OF THE BIG ISLAND... .A large northwest swell (310-320 degrees) will continue to produce very high surf along most north and west facing shores of the smaller islands, as well as elevated surf along exposed west facing shores of the Big Island through early Tuesday morning. this swell will lower Tuesday into Wednesday. ...HIGH SURF WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM HST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Surf of 20 to 25 feet along north facing shores, and 15 to 20 feet along west facing shores. * WHERE...Along north and west facing shores of Kauai, Niihau, Oahu, and Molokai, and along north facing shores of Maui. * WHEN...Through 6 AM HST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Very High...Expect ocean water surging and sweeping across beaches, coastal benches, and lava flows creating the potential for impacts to coastal properties and infrastructure, including roadways. Powerful longshore and rip currents will be present at most beaches.
info.instruction: Stay away from the shoreline along the affected coasts. Be prepared for road closures. Postpone entering or leaving channels affected by the high surf until the surf subsides.
